content.text:
# Oman–Zanzibar war

The Oman–Zanzibar war (; ) was a 1784 conflict between the Omani Empire and Zanzibar. It was the first time they had fought since 1779. Zanzibar, a colony of Oman, rebelled with the support of African forces from Mombasa and Pemba Island. Oman had to retake Zanzibar by force, capturing it in a short war. The Omani force was dispatched by Hilal bin Ahmad, eldest son of Sultan Ahmad bin Said al-Busaidi.
References
* A History of the African People. Robert William July (1998)
* Historical atlas of Oman Michael Isaac (2004)
